attributes.description: The frequency at which navigational sensor inputs are refreshed to support real-time decision making.
attributes.name: updateInterval

attributes.description: The level of redundancy implemented in safety-critical modules to ensure fault-tolerant operation.
attributes.name: faultTolerance

attributes.description: The maximum processing cycle time for computational tasks in the flight management algorithms.
attributes.name: processingCycleTime

attributes.description: The positional and sensor data accuracy requirement for navigational inputs.
attributes.name: sensorPrecision

attributes.description: Security encryption standard for protecting communication and stored flight data.
attributes.name: encryptionStandard

designScenario.description: The Flight Management System (FMS) is a comprehensive avionics solution that integrates flight planning, navigation, autopilot interfacing, sensor data fusion, and environmental monitoring. It is engineered to optimize flight trajectories, manage fuel consumption, and dynamically adjust flight routes in response to real-time atmospheric and operational conditions. Designed for high reliability and compliance with stringent aviation safety standards, the FMS utilizes advanced redundancy and security protocols to ensure optimum performance during all phases of flight.
designScenario.name: Flight Management System

details.description: Capture and synthesize data from multiple sensors including GPS, INS, and LIDAR to compute optimal flight trajectories in real-time.
Provide automated flight path adjustments in response to dynamic weather conditions and airspace restrictions.

requirements.title: Real-time Flight Navigation and Trajectory Optimization

details.description: Integrate environmental sensor data to optimize fuel management and ensure efficient flight routing amidst varying atmospheric conditions.
Support direct interfacing with the autopilot system to issue control commands based on computed flight paths.

requirements.title: Dynamic Flight Routing and Autopilot Interfacing

details.description: Process sensor and navigational data within a 50ms processing cycle to guarantee timely decision-making.
Ensure emergency re-routing computations are completed within 500ms under peak load conditions.
Implement triple modular redundancy in all core modules to eliminate single points of failure.
Continuously monitor system health and issue immediate alerts to flight crew on detection of sensor discrepancies or module failures.
Ensure user interfaces are designed for clarity and ease-of-use, minimizing the training required for operation.
Adopt modular software and hardware architectures to facilitate smooth system updates and upgrades.
Employ industry-leading cybersecurity practices to safeguard against unauthorized access and data breaches.

relationships.description: The Core Flight Computer encompasses and controls the Navigation Suite for processing sensor data.
The Core Flight Computer is integrated with the Autopilot Interface to convert computed flight paths into control commands.
The Communications Hub is associated with the Core Flight Computer to facilitate real-time data exchange with external systems.
The Flight Planning Module is associated with the Core Flight Computer to optimize flight paths based on real-time conditions.
The Data Management Unit aggregates and archives outputs from the Core Flight Computer for historical analysis and regulatory compliance.
The Environmental Sensor Array provides supplementary weather and atmospheric data critical to the Navigation Suite.

systemComponents.description: Central unit responsible for flight computation, sensor fusion, and coordination across all FMS modules.
systemComponents.name: Core Flight Computer

systemComponents.description: Subsystem that integrates multiple navigational sensors for precise position and motion tracking.
systemComponents.name: Navigation Suite

subComponents.description: GPS module for satellite-based location tracking.
subComponents.name: GPS Module

subComponents.description: Inertial Measurement Unit (IMU) for accelerometer and gyroscope data.
subComponents.name: Inertial Measurement Unit

subComponents.description: LIDAR system providing high-resolution distance and obstacle data.
subComponents.name: LIDAR System

systemComponents.description: Module responsible for converting mode-computed commands into signals that can be interpreted by the autopilot.
systemComponents.name: Autopilot Interface

subComponents.description: Converts flight commands into control signals for the autopilot.
subComponents.name: Control Signal Converter

subComponents.description: Logs flight data for post-flight analysis and system tuning.
subComponents.name: Flight Data Logger

systemComponents.description: Handles communication between the aircraft and external systems such as air traffic control and weather services.
systemComponents.name: Communications Hub

subComponents.description: VHF transceiver for short-range, line-of-sight communications.
subComponents.name: VHF Transceiver

subComponents.description: SATCOM unit for long-range satellite communications.
subComponents.name: SATCOM Unit

systemComponents.description: Software module that provides comprehensive pre-flight and in-flight planning capabilities including route and fuel management.
systemComponents.name: Flight Planning Module

systemComponents.description: Module that archives and manages flight data, logs, and historical performance metrics for regulatory compliance and analysis.
systemComponents.name: Data Management Unit

systemComponents.description: Subsystem dedicated to collecting weather and environmental data during flight operations.
systemComponents.name: Environmental Sensor Array

subComponents.description: Weather radar system for real-time cloud and storm detection.
subComponents.name: Weather Radar

subComponents.description: Temperature sensor for monitoring ambient conditions.
subComponents.name: Temperature Sensor

subComponents.description: Pressure sensor to determine altitude-related atmospheric pressure.
subComponents.name: Pressure Sensor
